title: India's 'Love Jihad' Laws Make Marriage Difficult For Interfaith Couples
description: In India, where arranged marriages are the norm, people typically marry within their religion or caste. But occasionally, some find love on their own and end up with a partner of a different faith.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: India's 'Love Jihad' Laws Make Marriage Difficult For Interfaith Couples
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: India's 'Love Jihad' laws seek to prevent forced religious conversions in interfaith marriages.
itunes:subtitle: India's 'Love Jihad' laws seek to prevent forced religious conversions in interfaith marriages.
content:encoded: In India, where arranged marriages are the norm, people typically marry within their religion or caste. But occasionally, some find love on their own and end up with a partner of a different faith.
